_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Good Morning Skiers and Riders! This is Eli with your 5 am snow report for Friday, January 9th . Remember the easiest way to get up to date information is on the Ikon Pass app or website.  

Its a powder day in the Boat! At Mid Mountain, weve had 12 new inches of snow in the past 24 hours, with 5 inches falling since the mountain closed yesterday.  

At the Summit, weve had 18 new inches of snow in the past 24 hours, with 8 inches falling since the mountain closed yesterday.  

Our Mid mountain base is 36, the temperature is 10 degrees, the winds are 6 miles per hour from the northwest, and its still snowing! 

The Summit base is 54 inches, the temperature is 1 degree, the winds 13 miles per hour from the northwest. 

The base temperature is 16 degrees.  

We will be skiing and riding on 19 lifts, 105 runs, and 1355 acres on POWDER snow.  Night Skiing and Riding will be available with a delayed start from 6pm-8:30pm with 4 runs and 1100 vertical feet off of Christie Peak Express. 

Today, Ski Patrol is conducting avalanche mitigation. The following runs may have delays or closures: North St Pats, East Face, Chute 1, 2 and 3 and No Name. Resort boundary gates 2, 3, 5, 7 and 8 are closed. Storm Peak and Morningside lifts may have delays or closures. Plan your route accordingly and respect all closures. 


Tonight, MusicFest at Steamboat celebrates 40 years of music, mountains, and unforgettable ski-town memories a tradition thats been rocking Steamboat since 1986. Dont miss the torchlight parade down the mountain, followed by fireworks lighting up the sky. Head to Steamboat Square tonight the celebration kicks off at 5:30. 

Stay in the know with the Ikon Pass App. Find it in the app store on your mobile device and get lift and trail statuses, conditions updates, and more.  

If you are thinking of exploring outside the ski area boundaries, and dont know exactly where you are going, dont go.  

Ski and Ride with Care and we will see you on the mountain!
